required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Management and Healthcare Utilization of Patients With Chronic Airway Disease During the COVID-19 Epidemic
clinical_study.official_title: Management and Healthcare Utilization of Patients With COPD and Asthma During the COVID-19 Epidemic in Beijing

brief_summary.textblock: During the COVID-19 epidemic, the medical treatment, disease status, and medication status of patients with chronic airway disease have not been studied. The purpose of this study is to investigate the management and healthcare utilization of patients with chronic airway disease and the influencing factors during the COVID-19 epidemic.

detailed_description.textblock: During the COVID-19 epidemic, the medical treatment, disease status, and medication status of patients with chronic airway disease have not been studied. The purpose of this study is to investigate the management and healthcare utilization of patients with chronic airway disease and the relevant factors during the COVID-19 epidemic. Using cross-sectional research methods, telephone interviews and questionnaire surveys were used to investigate the management and healthcare utilization of patients with chronic airway disease （COPD and asthma）during the COVID-19 epidemic.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 week.

primary_outcome.measure: Frequency of exacerbation during the COVID-19 epidemic
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 2 week.
primary_outcome.description: Frequency of exacerbation during the COVID-19 epidemic

study_pop.textblock: All patients in the database were involved.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- COPD patients and asthma patients in the Chronic Airway Disease Database in Peking University Third Hospital.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Refusal to participate in this study; cognitive dysfunction.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Head of Respiratory and Critical Care Medicine
